0.name: At the Base of some Steps
desc: "   You are at the base of a series of steps that lead from the
fortress at the top of the mountain to the bridge just to the west
of here.  The steps are made of white marble with some golden letters
engraved into them.  The steps need all the way from this gravel path
up and around the great grey fortress that sits on the top of the hill.
Despite the brooding nature of the fortress the gentle gurgling of the
water under the bridge and the gently bending grasses that cover the
hill give a peaceful image to this area.

1.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are on the steps leading from the fortress to the bridge you
can see at the base of the mountain.  The ground on either side of the
path looks very luxuriant, with abundant grasses and groves of fruit
trees.  There is some writing on the white steps, some of which you
can make out.  There is a gentle breeze flowing from the north,
pushing you slightly down the steps.
"   You can make out three words on the three nearest steps.
Peace
Balance
War

2.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are a little way up from the base of the steps.  The hill
blocks the view to the north and east, but to the west you can see
a great river flowing from the mountains to the south northward.  To
the west all you can see is a great plain of grasses, green and yellow.
The centre of the steps are slightly depressed, worn away with time,
the golden letters raised a little, less worn than the rock.
"   You can make out three words on the three nearest steps.
Love
Apathy
Hatred

3.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are a way up from the base of the staircase.  You can see from
here that the steps level out to form a circle around the walls of the
fortress.  The grey walls are tall and looming from this angle, hiding
all within those walls from sight.  From here you can see a large
entrance on the southern side of the fortress.
The letters are indecipherable, worn away with time.  What
letters you can make out have been inscribed in some fine swirling
script.

4.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are a way up from the base of the staircase.  You can see from
here that the steps level out to form a circle around the walls of the
fortress.  The grey walls are tall and looming from this angle, hiding
all within those walls from sight.
The letters are indecipherable, worn away with time.  What
letters you can make out have been inscribed in some fine swirling
script.

5.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are on some worn marble steps.  There must have been a lot of
feet to have worn away the hard white stone and even the golden letters
look faint and hard to see.  There are some cornfields on either side
of the mountain, small fields, partitioned by grey stone walls, running
up the length of the mountain.
"   The letters are indecipherable, worn away with time.  What
letters you can make out have been inscribed in some fine swirling
script

6.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are halfway up the side of the mountain.  From here you can
look east and south.  To the east you can see the barren land and
beyond that the great ocean.  There are lots of low-lying clouds to
the north, but the mountain still blocks most of that from view.
From here, looking south, the river seems quite small, but you are
at such a height that down close it must be quite wide.  The fruit
groves on either side of the path look very lush and are abundant
with fruit.
"   You can make out three words on the three nearest steps, written
in a jagged manner.
Good
Either
Evil

7.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are on a white marble stair-way.  The steps lead from the river
valley to a large plateau at the top of the mountain, on which a great
fortress stands.  The steps level off to the northwest and go steeply
down the side of the mountain in the other direction.  Despite the
strong wind it seems peaceful here, quiet, with few other travellers
on the steps.  Up north you can see some steps leading inward from the
main staircase.
"   You can make out three words on the three nearest steps, written
in a jagged manner.
Heal
Ignore
Kill

8.name: On a Staircase of White Marble Steps
desc: "   You are at the base of some steps which lead up to the plateau and
into the great fortress.  The arch of the entrance in solid black, a
sharp change from the white marble steps leading to it.  The main
stairway leads down and around the mountain and in the other direction
north-eastward, circling the great grey walls of the mountain.  From
here you have a great view of the Sleeping Giant Mountains to the south
and the blue-grey waters of the great ocean to the west.
"   You can make out three words on the three nearest steps, written
in a jagged manner.
Give to the Needy
Let them Fend for Themselves
Kill them if they have nothing

9.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are walking along the northern wall of the fortress.  From here
you can see the seas to the north and west, the cold lands across the
straits.  The grey walls loom over the path.  To the southeast you can
see a series of steps leading down from the plateau and some others
leading back inward.

10.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are walking on a paved path, consisting of large marble
flagstones.  The grey walls of the fortress loom high above you, coming
right to the edge of the path.  The path itself is not very wide and
off to the edge of it there is a steep drop before you reach the stone-
walled fields and orchard groves.  There is a strong wind blowing from
the east.

11.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are walking along a marble path.  You are at a point on the path
where you can see in almost every direction , with the bulk of the
fortress blocking your view to the southeast.  To the distant west
you can see a large city on the coastline, and much closer a much
smaller collection of buildings, at the mouth of some river.

12.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are walking along a small path, perilously close to the edge
of the mountain.  The view here is tremendous but the strong wind
blowing from the northeast makes you check your footing regularly.
To the southwest you can see a large entrance leading into the fortress.

13.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are at an entrance leading into the fortress.  A path leads
in both directions around the grey walls.  Looking at the entrance you
cannot see through it, some haze blocks your stare but the grey granite
stands out from the boring grey walls, like a statement of ownership.

14.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are walking along a narrow path on the lip of a plateau.  There
is a steep fall if you step from the path.  The grey walls of the keep
loom over the path.  The marble slabs are very old, though they are not
cracked or broken, grooves have been worn into them from the passage
of many feet.

15.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are at the southern wall of the fortress.  From here you can
see the great seas to the north, in the distance you can see a small
town at the mouth of a river, feeding into a massive bay.  To the north
you can see a large entrance into the fortress and another one to
your south-east.

16.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are on a small narrow path, well trodden and worn with wear.
The grey walls of the fortress loom over the path, bathing it in
shadows.  From here a large river can be seen, flowing from the
mountains to the south to a large bay in the north.  There is a small
town at the junction of the river with the sea.  To your east you
can see that the path leads to a large entrance into the keep.

17.name: Walking along a Small Path on the Plateau
desc: "   You are at an entrance in the southern wall, leading into the keep.
The entrance is bounded by a white silver border with detailed writing
engraved upon it.  The path upon which you are standing consists of
large white marble flagstones, well worn with wear and the passage of
time.  The edge of the path comes very close to the edge of the hill
and there is a strong wind blows from the west.

extra.desc: "   You are too far away to make out what is written.

18.name: In a Tall Archway
desc: "   You are just outside a large open gate.  To the north you can see
the massive gate with several large guards.  Just to the south you can
see a white marble path leading away westward, quickly disappearing out
of sight.  The arch that you are standing at the entrance of is very
tall, towering twenty feet high and at least that across.  There is
little traffic passing through the gate, just a few odd companions,
some clerics and heavily armed companions.

19.name: Standing in a Large Archway
desc: "   You are just outside a large open gate.  To the southeast you can
see the massive gate with several large guards.  Just to the northwest
you can see a white marble path leading away, both to the south and
north.  The arch that you are standing at the entrance of is very
tall, towering twenty feet high and at least that across.  There is
little traffic passing through the gate, just the odd warrior and
an infrequent scholarly type.

20.name: Standing in a Tall, Black Archway
desc: "   You are just outside a large open gate.  To the southwest you can
see the massive gate with several large guards.  Just to the northeast
you can see some steps leading down to a white marble
you can see a white marble path leading away, both to the south and
north.  The arch that you are standing at the entrance of is very
tall, towering twenty feet high and at least that across.  There is
little traffic passing through the gate, just the odd warrior and
an infrequent scholarly type.

21.name: Outside the Great Gate
desc: "   You at a large gate.  Massive pillars stand on either side of the
gate holding this mass of metal in place.  The gate is covered in
carvings and inscriptions, all inscribed with silver.  There is a
smaller gate within the gate which you can see being opened by the
guards, allowing foot-passengers to pass without needing to
open the main gates.  Though the guards and gates look and appear
highly ornamental, the weapons and looks in their eyes, and the massive
thickness of the gate indicate a more serious nature.

22.name: Just Inside the Great Gate
desc: "   You are at the edge of the plaza that lies within the walls of the
keep.  There is a bustling crowd milling all around the plaza but here
in the archway leading to the gate guarding the entrance there is
relative peace.  From here you can see that the gate is covered in
runes and wards, in massive quantities and carefully arranged.  You
can see a smaller gate near the centre of the main gate being opened
for pilgrims to the keep.

23.name: Just Outside of the Great Gate
desc: "   You at a large gate.  Massive pillars stand on either side of the
gate holding this mass of metal in place.  The gate is covered in
carvings and inscriptions, all inscribed with a deep blue ceramic.
There is a smaller gate within the gate which you can see being opened
by the guards, allowing foot-passengers to pass without needing to
open the main gates.  The guards look very serious, carefully scanning
the travellers, the scholars even more so than the warriors.

24.name: Inside of the Great Gate
desc: "   You are at the edge of the plaza that lies within the walls of the
keep.  There is a bustling crowd milling all around the plaza but here
in the archway leading to the gate guarding the entrance there is
relative peace.  From here you can see that the gate is covered in
magical wards, probably to enhance the strength of the walls and
gate.  You can see a smaller gate near the centre of the main gate
being opened for pilgrims to the keep.

25.name: Just Outside of the Great Gate
desc: "   You at a large gate.  Massive pillars stand on either side of the
gate holding this mass of metal in place.  The gate is covered in
carvings and inscriptions, all inscribed with red gold.  There is a
smaller gate within the gate which you can see being opened by the
guards, allowing foot-passengers to pass without needing to open
the main gates.  There are some clerics standing with the guards,
and every now and then the guards grab some passer-by and pull them
over to a dark alcove.

26.name: At the Edge of the Plaza near the Great Gate
desc: "   You are at the edge of the plaza that lies within the walls of the
keep.  There is a bustling crowd milling all around the plaza but here
in the archway leading to the gate guarding the entrance there is
relative peace.  From here you can see that the gate is covered in
black and red crystals, glowing and throbbing in the half-light of
the archway.  There is a dense cluster of the crystals near the
small gate at the base of the greater gate.

30.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the corner of the plaza.  Directly to the east
you can see the entrance of the circular cathedral bulge out towards
the centre of the plaza.  There is a large set of rooms leading off
an entrance near you, it has the smell of a hospital and several of
the people entering the room are injured.

31.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing alongside the western wall of the plaza.  There is
the enticing smell of freshly baked bread and hot fruit pies wafting
on the breeze from a nearby shop.  Also nearby you can see a shop
purporting to sell items of clerical use.

32.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the edge of the plaza, at the junction of the
outer and inner walls.  The outer wall continues along, protecting
the entire keep whereas the slightly smaller wall branches from the
main wall and continues to the massive cathedral at the centre of
the plaza.  At least twenty large white pennants hang from the wall
off great silver bars.  From this quiet vantage point you can see
straight across the plaza.  There are a huge number of people, many
of them gathering at the shops and dwellings built into the thick
walls of the plaza, there are some of them not to far from you to the
north.

33.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the edge of the plaza, just at the entrance to
a long tunnel leading to a large gate.  All around you can see a great
profusion of people, warriors and scholars alike.  Moving in the crowd
you can see several figures robed in white.  A gentle fluttering over
your head reminds you of the massively thick grey walls surrounding
the plaza, like a triangle with the great cathedral at its point.
Along the walls you can see the large white pennants whose flutterings
attracted your attention.

34.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the edge of the plaza, at the junction of the
outer and inner walls.  The outer wall continues along, protecting
the entire keep whereas the slightly smaller wall branches from the
main wall and continues to the massive cathedral at the centre of
the plaza.  At least twenty large white pennants hang from the wall
off great silver bars.  From here you can see that there is heavy
trade with the buildings carved into the inner wall.  There are also
it seems a lot of wounded people coming from the same place as well.

35.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing alongside the eastern wall of the plaza.  The faint
smell of fresh oil reminds you of the small weapons shop built into the
wall.  Looking in the window, or rather the hole knocked into the wall,
you can see a range of weapons, from longswords to clubs and hammers.
Elsewhere in the plaza you can see the great cathedral with its golden
dome and along every wall the great hanging pennants, all in the same
pure white.

36.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing at the corner of the plaza.  Directly to the west
you can see the entrance of the circular cathedral bulge out towards
the centre of the plaza.  There is a large gap between the doors here,
most of which are closed but there is one open leading into a long
corridor.  There is a steady passage of people passing through it, all
girded for battle and prayer.  Several of the people passing back out
of the corridor look haggard and often wounded severely.

37.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing before the magnificent entrance of the cathedral.
From here you can see the great marble walls tower fifty feet over the
plaza and over that again is the great golden dome.  All along the
walls of the cathedral you can see many white pennants, fluttering
gently in the breeze.  There is a heavy stream of traffic leading
both in and out of the large archway to the north.  There is a small
line of people waiting to enter.  A faint smell of incense is detectable
on the air.  Taking a quick look around the rest of the plaza you can
see the busy rooms built into the inner walls and the many small groups
of people who just stop in the middle of the plaza and starting talking
about, or arguing over, some item.

38.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of a great plaza.  There are small
groups of people everywhere, just standing where they meet and talking
and arguing with each other.  There are several people here standing on
small boxes, preaching.  Its a little different here than expected,
the people are talking about, correcting the speakers, telling them
how to improve their presentation, how to move their arms and avoid
looking into the sun and other mundanities. As soon as one person leaves
another rapidly fills the vacant spot and it all starts over again.
It is hard to stay in place and listen to the speakers with the heavy
traffic in all directions, north to the great cathedral, south to the
entrance, and east and west to the base of the inner walls of this keep.
The plaza must be massive as the people at the far walls look very small.

39.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of a great plaza.  There are small
groups of people everywhere, just standing where they meet and talking
and arguing with each other.  There is a sense of peace in the entire
area, with only the sound of the clacking of armoured feet and the
whispering of leathered shoes against the granite flagstones.  Looking
around you can almost imagine the plaza as a small river with the
people travelling like water around the rocks of talking  people.
It is hard to stay in place with the heavy traffic in all directions,
north to the great cathedral, south to the entrance, and east and west
to the base of the inner walls of this keep.  The plaza must be massive
as the people at the far walls look no bigger than your little finger,
at least a thousand feet across from wall to wall.

40.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "    You are standing at the corner of the plaza.  Directly to the south-
east you can see the entrance of the circular cathedral bulge out
towards the centre of the plaza.  There is a large gap between the doors
here, most of which are closed but there is one open leading into a long
corridor.  There is a steady passage of people passing through it, all
girded for battle and prayer.  Several of the people passing back out
of the corridor look near death, some are immediately aided by some
passer-bys.

41.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing alongside the northern wall of the plaza.  The faint
smell of fresh oil reminds you of the small weapons shop built into the
wall.  Looking in the window, or rather the hole knocked into the wall,

Elsewhere in the plaza you can see the great cathedral with its golden

its point.  Along the walls you can see the large blue pennants whose
flutterings attracted your attention.

49.name: The Central Plaza
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of a great plaza.  There are small
groups of people everywhere, just standing where they meet and talking
and arguing with each other.  There are several people here standing on
small boxes, preaching. The crowd listens patiently, the odd person
heckles as the preacher makes some statement that they disagree with.
As soon as one person leaves another rapidly fills the vacant spot and
it all starts over again.  It is hard to stay in place and listen to

60.name: At the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are outside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The
walls of the corridor are plated in copper with runes and gems inserted
in the walls in complex patterns.  There is some writing on the wall
near you.  You are standing close to one of the walls to keep out of
the way of the many passing people, dressed in both robes and armour.
They all pause momentarily in the middle of the corridor but quickly
pass through.  There is a faint smell of incense drifting from the
cathedral

61.name: The Centre of the Copper Corridor
desc: "   You are at the centre of a narrow corridor, the walls, ceiling and
floors of this corridor have been coated in copper.  There are four
large crystals placed directly above you and below, and each wall,
recessed and inaccessible, secure behind some crystal sheeting.  You
can feel a slight tingle as you stand here.

extra.desc: You are attacked by the wards of the cathedral.

62.name: Just Inside the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are inside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The
walls of the corridor are plated in copper with runes and gems inserted
in complex patterns.  In the half-light of the cathedral you can see
rows and rows of wooden pews leading to a central altar at the head
of the church.  The path between the pews consists of grey granite,
flags, the tiny flecks of quartz twinkling in the candle-light.

63.name: At the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are outside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The
walls of the corridor are plated in copper with runes and gems inserted
in the walls in complex patterns.  There is some writing on the wall
near you.  You are standing close to one of the walls to keep out of
the way of the many passing people, dressed in both robes and armour.
They all pause momentarily in the middle of the corridor but quickly
pass through.  There is a faint smell of incense drifting from the
cathedral

64.name: Just Inside the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are inside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The

65.name: The Centre of the Copper Corridor
desc: "   You are at the centre of a narrow corridor, the walls, ceiling and

recessed and inaccessible, secure behind some crystal sheeting.  Lances

soul to shreds.

66.name: The Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are outside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The

extra.desc: "   Be warned all you who would enter, thy soul will be tested.

desc: "   You are at the centre of a narrow corridor, the walls, ceiling and

"   The crystals begin to glow and spit out icy flames, directly
at you !!!!!

desc: "   You are at the centre of a narrow corridor, the walls, ceiling and

"   The crystals begin to glow and suddenly start shooting long
tongues of flame at you!!

74.name: Just Inside the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are inside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The
walls of the corridor are plated in copper with runes and gems inserted
in complex patterns.  In the half-light of the cathedral you can see
rows and rows of wooden pews leading to a central altar at the head
of the church.  The path between the pews consists of large black basalt
flags, the glassy surface reflecting the flickering candle-flames.

75.name: The Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are outside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The
walls of the corridor are plated in copper with runes and gems inserted

desc: "   You are inside the cathedral, at one end of a short corridor.  The

77.name: The Centre of the Copper Corridor
desc: "   You are at the centre of a narrow corridor, the walls, ceiling and
floors of this corridor have been coated in copper.  There are four
large crystals placed directly above you and below, and each wall,
recessed and inaccessible, secure behind some crystal sheeting.  Lances
of fire stream from the crystals, piercing you, ripping your body and
soul to shreds.

80.name: Near the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing near the entrance to the cathedral.  Looking south
you can see through the copper-coated corridor to the plaza outside.
Tall candles in tall bronze stands line the aisles, lending a dim
flickering light to this great room.  From your current location you
get a great view of the massive domed roof, curving from the walls at
your back to a centre pillar in the centre.  There are two shimmering
walls on either side of the section that you are in, a strange artefact
but one that forms a small triangle with all the pews facing to the
centre.  The pews themselves are full of people, praying, their prayers
combining to form a gentle hum in the background.  The pews are arranged
in two blocks, separated by a central aisle.

81.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  At the back of the alcove you can see
a large statue but you are too far away to make out any details.  You
need to be swift on your feet as the passing pilgrims are deeply absorbed
by their prayers, sometimes bumping to each other, a slight mutter of
apology and they restart their prayers.  The pews are made from solid
oak, no padding on the kneelers or the seats.  There are some spaces
available on a nearby pew.

82.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  Looking a little to the east you can
see that there is another such chapel.  To the west you can see that
the shimmering wall is closer and yet does not seem close.  Turning
away from the sight you can see the half-filled oak pews filling the
space between you and the high altar.  Looking at some of the pews
closely you can see that a few have been marked with graffiti and
other personal comments.

83.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews, right
beside the shimmering wall separating this part of the cathedral from
the rest.  Looking at the wall closely you can seem to focus on it, it
swims in and out, it feels solid to the touch but you cant figure out
what it is.  It just shimmers.  The pews and cathedral on the other
hand look very real and full of humming people praying.  The shimmering
wall goes from the back wall all the way up to the high altar.

84.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  At the back of the alcove you can see
a large statue but you are too far away to make out any details.  There
are several people praying devoutly to the statue, some very fervently.
Between you and the central altar you can see rows and rows of pews.
They are made from solid oak, with no padding on the kneelers or the
seats.  There are some spaces available on a nearby pew but in total the
entire cathedral must be able to hold three or four thousand people

85.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  Looking a little to the east you can
see that there is another such chapel.  To the east you can see that
the shimmering wall is closer and yet does not seem close.  Looking
up at the tall back wall you can see large white pennants.  In the
half-light of the church you can see several beams of light coming
from somewhere near the roof and pointing at the central altar, the
mites of dust dancing in the beams.

86.name: In the Aisles at the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews, right
beside the shimmering wall separating this part of the cathedral from
the rest.  Looking at the wall closely you can seem to focus on it, it
swims in and out, it feels solid to the touch but you can't figure out
what it is.  It just shimmers.  The pews and cathedral on the other
hand look very real and full of humming people praying.  The shimmering
wall goes from the back wall all the way up to the high altar.

87.name: Standing in the Central Aisle of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch
out in the distance.  The gentle shuffle of supplicants and the hum
of prayer mingles with the dancing dust-mites in the sunbeams to form
a quietness that eases the mind.  Looking up at the great dome of the
room you can see that a central pillar rises from the ground, up through
the roof.  All along the edges of the dome, at the point where it rests
on the outer wall you can see large colour panes of glass through
which the multi-coloured beams of light pass.

88.name: Standing in the Central Aisle of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch
out in the distance.  You are standing at the centre of one of the large
crystal-flecked flagstones that form the aisles.  You are bathed in
the multi-coloured beams of sunlight that flow from the panes of glass
at the base of the dome, soft colours dance over your eyes and face.
To the north you can see some steps leading to the high altar, many
people are gathered around the steps but few enter.  Looking aside from
the altar you can see the shimmering walls in the distance and the
solid granite wall at the back of the church.  The fluttering candles
dot the church, giving off a soft yellow light and a strong smell of
incense and myre.

89.name: At the Junction of the Centre Aisle and the High Altar
desc: "   You are the base of the steps leading up to the high altar.  From
here you can see two statues of Aelen, the most revered.  There are
some marble steps leading into the high altar which is behind some
silver railings.  There are large numbers of people on either side
of you praying fervently in front of the statues.  The ones to the
east seem to be more of the military type than the scholars to the
west.  Looking back down the church the immensity of the entire
cathedral is clear, the panes of glass at the base of the dome centre
sunlight on the high altar, bathing it in colours, the immense numbers
of pews and sound of prayer is funnelled up by the walls to the
high altar and above the altar itself a large pillar is suspended
from the roof of the dome.

90.name: In an Aisle near the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
beams of light from the base of the great dome lighting the dust
particles in their endless dance of praise to the true heavenly powers.

91.name: In Front of A Great Statue
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive marble statue of Aelen, garbed
in armour and holding a shield and sword.  The shield has the insignia
of Minton on it, three circles intertwined.  The sword has two words
visible on it but their fine writing is in a language unknown to you.
There is a small plaque beneath the statue.  Elsewhere from this location
you can see the great number of people entering and leaving the church,
the other statues and the beauty of this place, but here are the warriors
praying for Aelens blessing before they go their dangerous ways.
"   Aelen, the most honoured and revered of all the brethren of our
order.  He fought and battle with the true Overlord of us all, Minton,
and taught us that compromise is not defeat.  In this statue you see
Aelen depicted in his warriors garb.  Aelen was renowned for hating
war but often led his paladins in victorious battle against the demons
of hell and of evil.  Mighty were his spells and skills, few could stand
in his way, fewer still could last for long.

92.name: In an Aisle near the Edge of the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
great dome in the heights above you.

93.name: In Front of a Great Statue
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive marble statue of Aelen, garbed
as a scholar.  In one arm he has clasped a book with two lightning
bolts engraved upon its cover, in the other hand he holds a sick child.
The face of the statues looks away from the book and towards the child,
a look of care and love for it.  You have to be quick to see that there
is a plaque at the base of the statue as there are enormous crowds of
people here, touching the statue for luck, whispering a quick prayer,
offering up a silent wish.
"   Aelen, the most honoured and revered of all the brethren of our order
in his time collected a massive library of ancient lore.  One of his
great achievements was the rediscovery and control of the ancient
magics, power from the earth but this time control from the spirit and
the soul.  With his light to lead us, Aelen shows us that power is not
the answer, the answer and solution comes from within, from ourselves
and our faith.  A main priority of Aelen was to shift the use of the
magic from the dangerous violent uses of old to healing and mending,
he thought it especially important to care for the sick and weak, for as
he was fond of saying 'Are not their souls as valuable as my own'.

95.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name MATHON and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers.  This is an alcove of quietness after the
bustle of the main church.
"   Mathon the Holy was one of the two disciples of Aelen.  With him
and Lanetta the two followed Aelen around.  Mathon is renowned for
his skills of persuasion.  Many are the converts who would swear on
Sacred Aelens Heart that when Mathon was preaching to the crowds that
it was if Mathon was speaking directly to them, filling their hearts
with the Holy Word.

96.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name LANETTA and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers.  This is an alcove of quietness after the
bustle of the main church.
"   Lanetta the Blessed was one of the two disciples of Aelen.  With her
and Mathon the two followed Aelen around. Lanetta is renowned for
her skills in aiding the sick in body and mind.  Multitudes there were
looking for just a simple touch in the belief that even that may ease
their ails.

97.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name RAMOUS and a small plaque.
There is currently no-one praying in the alcove but you can see that
there are little strips of folded paper slipped under the base of the
statue.
"   Ramous the Visionary was a student of Minton, originally a native
of Endar he spoke with the fabled creatures that inhabit that isle
and the craftsmen of Mythra and learnt of the Unification Theory.  It
was he that first encourage our order to take up the challenge that
Minton proposed, to conquer ourselves and place evil in abeyance.  If
it were not for he the future of the world and of this order may have
been forever ruined.  Apart from this place in history, praying to
the Statue of Ramous has been attributed to several miraculous blessings.
"   The little strips of paper are squeeze into the narrow crack at
the base of the statue.  There form a fan like curtain at the junction.
You try to see what is written on the inside of the paper scrolls but
they are wrapped too tightly for you to make out.

98.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre but they are
not lit.  The alcove is strangely dark except for a single candle encased
in red glass, giving off a red glow to the statue.  At the base of the
statue you can see in the glow the name SEYLAREN-LI and a small plaque.
There are a few people in the alcove apart from yourself but not a word
aloud do they utter.
"   Seylaren is a member of one of the elven clans.  What was unusual
about Seylaren was that he grew up practising the skills of necromancy
and other dark skills.  Seylaren excelled in his skills and loved to
challenge others to tests of skills whereupon he once challenged a
cleric of Minton.  The cleric prayed for protection and strength and
it was granted, even the greatest and worst of Seylarens spells failed
and he was defeated without a blow in return.  What was more miraculous
was his claim that a voice spoke from the cleric and argued with him
for three days and nights, at which end Seylaren understood the errors
of his ways.  He returned to his clan in the shadowdale Forests and
preached a new way.  Blessed with divine skills he was successful but
his enemies cursed him and insulted him with the suffix LI, a grievous
insult but Seylaren-Li took it and made it his own.  Thus the clan was
divided, the followers of Seylaren used the suffix LI, the followers
of the dark path LA.  After this Seylaren-Li did many wondrous deeds
and in time was appointed High Cleric of Minton.

100.name: Near the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing near the entrance to the cathedral.  Looking to the

"   A nearby candle splutters and spits out hot wax, making you and
the people nearby jump with surprise

desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch

"   The gentle murmur of prayer floats over the sound of crackling

108.name: In an Aisle at the Centre of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch
out in the distance.  You are standing at the centre of one of the large

109.name: In Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are the base of the steps leading up to the high altar.  From
here you can see two statues of Damock, the most revered.  There are
some marble steps leading into the high altar which is behind some
silver railings.  There are large numbers of people on either side
of you praying fervently in front of the statues.  The ones to the
northwest seem to be more of the military type than the scholars to the

110.name: Standing in an Outer Aisle of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close

inside, forming a small chapel.  Looking a little to the north you can

111.name: Standing in An Aisle Half-Way Up the Church
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews, right

wall goes from the back wall all the way up to the high altar.

112.name: In the Outer Aisle, near the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
great dome in the heights above you.

113.name: In the Outer Aisle, near the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
beams of light from the base of the great dome lighting the dust
particles in their endless dance of praise to the true heavenly powers.
From hear you can see all the large red pennants hanging from the back
wall of the church.

114.name: In Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive marble statue of Damock, garbed
in armour and holding a shield and sword.  The shield has the insignia
of Minton on it, three circles intertwined.  The sword has two words
visible on it but their fine writing is in a language unknown to you.
There is a small plaque beneath the statue.  Elsewhere from this location
you can see the great number of people entering and leaving the church,
the other statues and the beauty of this place, but here are the warriors
praying for Damocks blessing before they go their dangerous ways.
"   Damock, one of the most feared and respected artificers of the dark
ways.  Damock believed in independence but respected power and wisdom,
and he saw that Mintons way was just another way of achieving ultimate
power.  Damock was a fearsome warrior.  His sword was reputed to be
endowed with the power of the demon world and his company of warriors
seemed unequalled in battle.  In later years many believed that this
was due to Damocks personal aura of power and that a touch from his or
even a look would guarantee safety in battle.

115.name: In Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive marble statue of Damock, garbed
as a scholar.  In one arm he has clasped a book with a large lightning
bolts engraved upon its cover, in the other hand a heart dripping blood
The look on his face is that of pure unadulterated power. You have to
be quick to see that there is a plaque at the base of the statue as
there are enormous crowds of people here, touching the statue for luck,
whispering a quick prayer, offering up a silent wish.
"   Damock was a great believer in that the accumulation of power was
a valid aim in of itself but he also realised that there was knowledge
and power to be obtained in working together, sacrificing now for future
gain.  To this end he financed a great library and laboratory.  Many
were the experiments carried out, many on the human body and others
beyond description.  The result of which was an immense ability to
heal and harm the human body and that of other races and access to the
deepest darkest powers of Altemia.

116.name: A Silent Alcove with A Large Marble Statue
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Fromm and a small plaque.
There is currently no-one praying in the alcove but you can see that
there are little strips of folded paper slipped under the base of the
statue.
"   Fromm was a master in the defensive arts, his skills in protecting
his companion Teagan with defensive spells and mystic auras was beyond
comparison in his age or any since.  It was said he could cover his
allies in shields of fire and could make them move like shadows through
the battlefield.  Fromm also had the reputation of taking payment, in
blood and coin, his spells were expensive to all but Teagan, and naught
was known of what he paid.  But even to this day many warriors and
clerics pray for Fromms blessing before trying some perilous deed.
"   The little strips of paper are squeeze into the narrow crack at
the base of the statue.  There form a fan like curtain at the junction.
You try to see what is written on the inside of the paper scrolls but
they are wrapped too tightly for you to make out.

117.name: A Silent Alcove with A Large Marble Statue
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre but they are
not lit.  The alcove is strangely dark except for a single candle encased
in red glass, giving off a red glow to the statue.  At the base of the
statue you can see in the glow the name Lorendril-LA and a small plaque.
There are a few people in the alcove apart from yourself but not a word
aloud do they utter.
"   Lorendril was a clan shaman before the arrival of Seylaren-Li.  With
Seylaren-Lis preaching his clan drifted away from their beliefs and
practices but Lorendril was not swayed.  He too began to preach, telling
of the ways of independence, the quest for power and knowledge, the
right to do what you want and not have to always obey the opinions of
others, the chance to be who you want to be and can be.  It soon appeared
that Lorendril and Seylaren were equal in skill and constantly battled
each others preaching.  Lorendril managed to save a large portion of
the elven clans from the weak minded philosophies of Seylaren and with
the uptake of the Li suffix by Seylaren he adopted the suffix of La,
hence the clan was divided.

118.name: A Silent Alcove with A Large Marble Statue
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Hwack and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers.  This is an alcove of quietness after the
bustle of the main church.
"   Hwack was a young alien woman who accompanied Damock in his travel.
None were capable of identifying her race but her curves and shapes
were alluring to all creatures and this she used to her own advantage.
Many were her lovers, few her partners.  She managed to accumulate great
wealth and saw Damock as her greatest challenge.  Damock was not one to
be beholden to another but for many years she tried, never given up.
Many women now revere her as a woman who proved that women do not need
to be quiet nor dependent on men.

119.name: A Silent Alcove with A Large Marble Statue
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Teagan and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers.  This is an alcove of quietness after the
bustle of the main church.
"   Damock was a leader who recognised the usefulness of companions.  To
this end he gathered three about him, Teagan, Hwack and Fromm.  These
fought many battles, together and apart.  Teagan was a warrior beyond
compared, a berserker, lacking a single spell or scholarly art to his
name but his constant companion Fromm was without compare in the
defensive arts and together Teagan was invincible.

120.name: Standing at the Entrance to the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing near the entrance to the cathedral.  Looking to the
north-west you can see through the copper-coated corridor to the plaza
outside.  Tall candles in tall bronze stands line the aisles, lending a
dim  flickering light to this great room.  From your current location
you get a great view of the massive domed roof, curving from the walls
at your back to a centre pillar in the centre.  There are two shimmering
walls on either side of the section that you are in, a strange artefact
but one that forms a small triangle with all the pews facing to the
centre.  The pews themselves are full of people, praying, their prayers
combining to form a gentle hum in the background.  The pews are arranged
in two blocks, separated by a central aisle.

121.name: Standing behind the Pews in the Back Row
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  At the back of the alcove you can see
a large statue but you are too far away to make out any details.  You
need to be swift on your feet as the passing pilgrims are deeply absorbed
by their prayers, sometimes bumping to each other, a slight mutter of
apology and they restart their prayers.  The pews are made from solid
oak, no padding on the kneelers or the seats.  There are some spaces
available on a nearby pew.

122.name: Standing behind the Pews in the Back Row
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  Looking a little to the north you can
see that there is another such chapel. You can see that the shimmering
wall is closer and yet does not seem close.  Turning away from the
sight you can see the half-filled oak pews filling the space between
you and the high altar.  Looking at some of the pews closely you can
see that a few have been marked with graffiti and other personal
comments.

123.name: Standing in a Corner in a Large Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews, right
beside the shimmering wall separating this part of the cathedral from
the rest.  Looking at the wall closely you can seem to focus on it, it
swims in and out, it feels solid to the touch but you can't figure out
what it is.  It just shimmers.  The pews and cathedral on the other
hand look very real and full of humming people praying.  The shimmering
wall goes from the back wall all the way up to the high altar.

124.name: Standing At the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  At the back of the alcove you can see
a large statue but you are too far away to make out any details.  There
are several people praying devoutly to the statue, some very fervently.
Between you and the central altar you can see rows and rows of pews.
They are made from solid oak, with no padding on the kneelers or the
seats.  There are some spaces available on a nearby pew but in total the
entire cathedral must be able to hold three or four thousand people
"   A nearby candle splutters and spits out hot wax, making you and
the people nearby jump with surprise

125.name: Standing At the Back of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews.  Close
to where you stand there is a small alcove in the wall with some pews
inside, forming a small chapel.  Looking a little to the north you can
see that there is another such chapel.  To the south you can see that
the shimmering wall is closer and yet does not seem close.  Looking
up at the tall back wall you can see large blue pennants.  In the
half-light of the church you can see several beams of light coming
from somewhere near the roof and pointing at the central altar, the
mites of dust dancing in the beams.

126.name: Standing in the Back Corner of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the church behind the pews, right
beside the shimmering wall separating this part of the cathedral from
the rest.  Looking at the wall closely you can seem to focus on it, it
swims in and out, it feels solid to the touch but you cant figure out
what it is.  It just shimmers.  The pews and cathedral on the other
hand look very real and full of humming people praying.  The shimmering
wall goes from the back wall all the way up to the high altar.

127.name: Standing in the Centre Aisle of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch
out in the distance.  The gentle shuffle of supplicants and the hum
of prayer mingles with the dancing dust-mites in the sunbeams to form
a quietness that eases the mind.  Looking up at the great dome of the
room you can see that a central pillar rises from the ground, up through
the roof.  All along the edges of the dome, at the point where it rests
on the outer wall you can see large colour panes of glass through
which the multi-coloured beams of light pass.
"   The gentle murmur of prayer floats over the sound of crackling
candles.

128.name: Standing in the Centre Aisle of the Cathedral
desc: "   You are standing in the middle of the cathedral.  The pews stretch
out in the distance.  You are standing at the centre of one of the large
crystal-flecked flagstones that form the aisles.  You are bathed in
the multi-coloured beams of sunlight that flow from the panes of glass
at the base of the dome, soft colours dance over your eyes and face.
To the southeast you can see some steps leading to the high altar, many
people are gathered around the steps but few enter.  Looking aside from
the altar you can see the shimmering walls in the distance and the
solid granite wall at the back of the church.  The fluttering candles
dot the church, giving off a soft yellow light and a strong smell of
incense and myre.

129.name: Standing in Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are the base of the steps leading up to the high altar.  From
here you can see two statues of Manthus, the most revered.  There are
some marble steps leading into the high altar which is behind some
silver railings.  There are large numbers of people on either side
of you praying fervently in front of the statues.  The ones to the
north-east seem to be more of the military type than the scholars to the
south-west.  Looking back down the church the immensity of the entire
cathedral is clear, the panes of glass at the base of the dome centre
sunlight on the high altar, bathing it in colours, the immense numbers
of pews and sound of prayer is funnelled up by the walls to the
high altar and above the altar itself a large pillar is suspended
from the roof of the dome.
"   A priest walks by waving an incense burner as he passes, the aroma
makes your nose wrinkle and cough.

130.name: Alongside the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
great dome in the heights above you.

131.name: Standing in Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive granite statue of Manthus, garbed
in armour and holding a large shield and dagger.  The shield has the
insignia of Minton on it, three circles intertwined.  From the belt of
the statue hangs several throwing stars, three pointed stars. Elsewhere
from this location you can see the great number of people entering and
leaving the church, the other statues and the beauty of this place, but
here are the warriors praying for Damocks blessing before they go their
dangerous ways.
"   Manthus, garbed in armour and holding a shield and dagger.  Manthus
was renowned for weighing the odds.  It was his belief that in
maintaining the balance between good and evil, the forces of light and
darkness, that most profit could be made.  Manthus philosophy was that
in the struggle was the profit but victory by either side would be dire
and in this way a balance was struck and has since lasted.  Manthus as
a warrior was a defensive warrior, behind his massive shield he would
ward of many blows and dart forward with short-sword or dagger.  Among
the most feared weapons of this paladin was his throwing daggers.  Three
pointed stars, finely balanced, a much feared skill of his Chressicaan
clan.

132.name: Standing in an Aisle beside the Shimmering Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the side of the church at the end of a line
of pews.  The shimmering wall is nearby but its twisting colours and
shapes force you to avoid looking at it.  Looking elsewhere you can
see the great altar at the top of the church, the entrance at the
back, the hundred of soft yellow lights from the candles and the
beams of light from the base of the great dome lighting the dust
particles in their endless dance of praise to the true heavenly powers.
From hear you can see all the large blue pennants hanging from the back
wall of the church.

133.name: Standing in Front of the High Altar
desc: "   You are at the top of the church, near the high altar.  In front
of you are several pews and a massive marble statue of Manthus, garbed
as a scholar. From one upraised hand hangs a small scales and in the
other a clerics staff.  There are some engravings in the base of the
statue representing the masses of people who begged aid of him.  You
have to be quick to see that there is a plaque at the base of the statue
as there are enormous crowds of people here, touching the statue for
luck, whispering a quick prayer, offering up a silent wish.
"   Manthus was a latecomer to the arts of the cleric but after the
founding of this Keep under the gaze of the Lord Minton he studied at
the feet of Damock and Aelen.  Manthus was a strange one, he never
varied from his basic teaching of whether or not his acts aid one side
or the other, he kept a balance, only make minor changes to the balance
and always at great profit to himself and his order.  Despite his
massive accumulation of wealth, Manthus always considered himself to be
a student in the clerical arts in comparison to the other creeds.

135.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Loran and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers. There is currently no-one praying in the alcove
but you can see that there are small piles of copper coins around the
base of the statue.
"   Loran is one of the few dwarves that have taken a strong interest in
the religious affairs of man, and what an interest.  Loran was a great
believer in the balance, and believe that financial wealth should be
redistributed.  He did not hesitate to weedle or beg, blackmail or
threaten from everyone and anyone but in return would offer a gift, be
it an object or a spell, a blessing or a curse but it would in hind-sight
always be fitting for the person who received it and made up for the
offering made to Loran.
"   There are small piles of copper coins surrounding the base of the
statue, though many who come to the cathedral look needy no-one seems
to have touched these.

136.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Bambo and a small plaque.
There are some people here praying in a small circle, walking around
repeating their prayers.  This is an alcove of quietness after the
bustle of the main church.
"    Bambo and Cranthunal were the two great pacifists of the Early Era.
During the construction of the great pact that unified the three creeds
these two travelled Arandia and Chressicaa preaching abstinence from
battle.  Bambo did this from the point of view that religion was
irrelevant and that the way you lived showed your inner soul and that
no-one was good or evil, just human.  Cranthunal disagreed with this but
after many famous debates agreed to differ as their aims concurred and
travelled together, collecting many converts.

137.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre.  At the
base of the statue you can see the name Cranthunal and a small plaque.
This is an alcove of quietness after the bustle of the main church.
"   Cranthunal and Bambo were the two great pacifists of the Early Era.
During the construction of the great pact that unified the three creeds
these two travelled Arandia and Chressicaa preaching abstinence from
battle.  Cranthunal believed that the human soul developed by struggling
between evil and good, between chaos and order and that victory by either
would destroy the soul.  A great preacher was he in this but never could
he persuade Bambo to this point of view.  After many long arguments, the
two agreed to differ as their aims concurred and travelled together,
collecting many converts and hindering the success of both order and
chaos.

138.name: In a Silent Alcove
desc: "   You are in a small alcove with several pews.  There are two large
candles on either side of the large statue in the centre but they are
not lit.  The alcove is strangely dark except for a single candle encased
in red glass, giving off a red glow to the statue.  At the base of the
statue you can see in the glow the name Pandrain and a small plaque.
There are a few people in the alcove apart from yourself but not a word
aloud do they utter.
"   Pandrain was a beautiful woman, a late disciple of Manthus.  Pandrain
underwent fierce tortures by some initiates of the dark creed but was
finally rescued by some zealots of Aelen.  Once rescued doubt crept into
her rescuers minds and they questioned her and imprisoned her, fearing
her true allegiance.  Aelen discovered their actions and released her but
knew that there were none left she could trust and asked Manthus to be
her guardian.  After many years Pandrain learnt the true meaning of
good and evil, order and chaos and no longer feared them but decided
that the world would be better off without them.  A crusading disciple
she managed to put a mortal fear into the other churches and through
her work many of the more extreme aspects of their religions were
discarded.  To this day her name is worship in thanks by many from all
alignments.

170.name: The Arena Entrance Hall
desc: "   You are standing in the centre of a large room.  To one side you can
see an exit leading out into the plaza and facing that exit you see
four more doors, each painted in a different colour and heavily barred.
There is a small group of people standing around the room, several are
wounded, most are armed with  knives and daggers, spell books and war-
swords.  There is a large plaque over each door, with the names,
APPRENTICE, SKILLED, EXPERT and MASTER.  Several people go through each
door and others return with  wounds and damaged armour.  There is a
large stone in the middle of the floor, within easy reach, which has
some writing on it.
"   You read the plaque with the word master on it.  The plaque
says that if you go through the black door you will be challenged by a
series of monsters.  These monsters are the darkest and blackest that
our arts can fabricate.  Be warned only the truest and surest of our
faith, the greatest masters of our order can stand along safely within
the rooms behind the black door.  Be warned, to all still learning
your skills, this room confers death to the boastful and the foolish.
"   You read the stone in the middle of the room.  It contains
instructions on the training arena.  In brief it says that once you
go through one of the doors you will be left in a room without exits.
Monsters will appear, in some rooms one at a time, in others in groups,
and you will be forced to defend yourself.  After a fixed period of time
the magic of the room will teleport you back to this room.  These rooms
are essential for the practice and training of the clerics and paladins
of our order.

171.name: The Training Arena
desc: "   You are in a room lit by a single glow-bulb.  The room measures
twenty feet by twenty with some obstacles and places to hide.  There
is no discernible exits or entrances.  There are red pennants hanging
from the four walls.  The floor of the room contains some bones and
dark brown stains.

172.name: The Training Arena
desc: "   You are in a room lit by a single glow-bulb.  The room measures
twenty feet by twenty with some obstacles and places to hide.  There
is no discernible exits or entrances.  There are blue pennants hanging
from the four walls.  The floor of the room contains some bones and
dark brown stains.

173.name: The Training Arena
desc: "   You are in a room lit by a single glow-bulb.  The room measures
twenty feet by twenty with some obstacles and places to hide.  There
is no discernible exits or entrances.  There are white pennants hanging
from the four walls.  The floor of the room contains some bones and
dark brown stains.

174.name: The Training Arena
desc: "   You are in a room lit by a single glow-bulb.  The room measures
twenty feet by twenty with some obstacles and places to hide.  There
is no discernible exits or entrances.  There are black pennants hanging
from the four walls.  The floor of the room contains some bones and
dark brown stains.
